item.title: CoD's Iconic Nuketown Map Gets A 4/20 Makeover Soon In Black Ops 6
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/cods-iconic-nuketown-map-gets-a-4-20-makeover-soon-in-black-ops-6/1100-6530460/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Call of Duty's popular Nuketown map has been reimagined over and over again throughout the series, and the latest evolution of the map--focused on the stoner holiday of 4/20--has now been revealed. Activision also announced a variety of other extras coming to Black Ops 6 themed around marijuana.

The new Nuketown variant is called "Blazetown," and it'll be available in Black Ops 6 multiplayer with the Season 3 Reloaded update at some point in the future. It's likely it'll be available by 4/20. Activision has only shared one image of Blazetown, but it does confirm one of the buses is decked out with flower power.

Also coming to Black Ops 6 to celebrate all things ganja is a limited-time mode called Joint Operations. This includes five core mode variants, all with excellent names: Head Stash (TDM), Inhalation (Domination), Hotbox (Hardpoint), Very High Target (HVT), and Munchies (Kill Confirmed).

The mode will make you trip out, eliciting "visual hallucinations" and sometimes shifting to a third-person POV to give you an out-of-body experience. The mode also includes double health and low gravity.

Finally, Activision announced that the popular stoners Jay and Silent Bob are coming to Black Ops 6 as playable characters. Players can deploy using their classic looks or their comic book versions--Bluntman and Chronic.

This DLC bundle includes the "Bluntman Stuntman" Krig C weapon and the "Chronic Unapologetic" Jackal PDW, along with the "Smoke You Out" finishing move, among other 4/20-themed items.

For more on Season 3, be sure to check out GameSpot's gallery below to see all the new content headed to Black Ops 6 soon. The new season arrives on April 2. As for Warzone, the game's OG map, Verdansk, drops in on April 3.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
